data.title: Tom Cruise’s ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ to Release Two Days Early
data.meta_description: Tom Cruise’s “Top Gun” sequel, “Top Gun: Maverick,” has been forwarded two days to June 24, giving the action movie a Wednesday start.
data.text:
Tom Cruise’s “Top Gun: Maverick” will fly forward two days to release on June 24, giving the blockbuster a Wednesday start.

Paramount Pictures made the announcement on Monday. The “Top Gun” sequel. Cruise is reprising his role as Captain Pete “Maverick” Mitchell from the original 1986 film.

A recent trailer for films showed Cruise being introduced thusly to young flyers in a hangar: “Your instructor is one of the finest pilots this program has ever produced. His exploits are legendary.What he has to teach you may very well mean the difference between life and death.”

“Oblivion” helmer Joseph Kosinski is directing the film from a script by Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren and Christopher McQuarrie. Jerry Bruckheimer, who produced the first movie with the late Don Simpson, will produce with Cruise, McQuarrie and Skydance CEO David Ellison.

“Only the Brave” star Miles Teller will play the son of Goose, Maverick’s co-pilot played by Anthony Edwards in the original movie, who’s Maverick’s new protege.

Popular on Variety

Val Kilmer will reprise his role as Tom “Iceman” Kazansky in the sequel. Jon Hamm, Ed Harris, Lewis Pullman, Charles Parnell, Jay Ellis, Bashir Salahuddin, Danny Ramirez, and Monica Barbaro round out the cast.

The original film was a massive success, grossing more than $350 million worldwide on a $15 million budget. Paramount had originally planned to release the film in the summer of 2019, but decided to move it back a year to give filmmakers the opportunity to work out the logistics of presenting flight sequences with new technology and planes.
